item.title: Helldivers 2’s Control Group Warbond Warp Pack Sounds a Lot Cooler Than It May Actually Be
item.description:
In just a few days, Helldivers 2 will bring players a brand-new Warbond, and it's promising a fun variety of exciting features. Set to launch on July 17, the Control Group Warbond is adding fresh armor, weapons, stratagems, and more to Helldivers 2 , but there is one standout item on the list.

The LIFT-182 Warp Pack is an intriguing addition to the Control Group Warbond lineup that promises players a game-changing way to dodge and traverse the map. This stratagem uses Dark Fluid to create a wormhole that players can use to teleport short distances. As exciting as this stratagem is, though, there is a huge downside that is incredibly on brand for Helldivers 2 : potential death.

Helldivers 2's LIFT-182 Warp Pack Can Only Be Used a Handful of Times

In the official announcement of the Warbond on PlayStation's blog, it states, "users should bear in mind that the wormhole cannot maintain integrity for extended periods–each jump will further destabilize it, and the wearer may experience death should the singularity fully collapse." That definitely throws a wrench in the stratagem's potential, but it also is a hilarious way to lean into Helldivers 2 's special brand of humor. The Control Group Warbond is all about testing unstable alien tech, so the high risk of using such items comes with the territory.

Helldivers Will Be Gambling With Every Use

For those who are hoping to use the LIFT-182 Warp Pack as a way to dart across the map, they may want to think twice. Even just using the stratagem a few times in succession could prove to be catastrophic. For the most part, it seems like the LIFT-182 Warp Pack is better suited for quick, last-minute dodges when there's absolutely no other option. Developer Arrowhead Game Studios is always looking for ways to enhance the difficulty of Helldivers 2 , and adding a teleportation pack that could kill a player after using it enough definitely adds a hilarious level of chance to the equation.

It was recently announced that Helldivers 2 will finally be coming to Xbox Series X/S on August 26.

Every Other Feature Included in the Control Group Warbond

  • Conductor of Brilliance Player Banner and Cape
  • Over Artifice Triumphant Player Banner and Cape
  • Protect Eardrums Victory Pose
  • Exemplary Subject Player Title
  • AD-49 Apollonian Heavy Armor
  • AD-26 Bleeding Edge Medium Armor
  • Adreno-Defibrillator Armor Passive
  • VG-70 Variable Primary Weapon
  • Plas-45 Epoch Stratagem
  • A/LAS-98 Laser Sentry Stratagem
  • G-31 Arc Throwable

In addition to the LIFT-182's significant downside, the VG-70 Variable can cause harm to players after offloading its remaining ammunition. Also, the A/LAS-98 Laser Sentry can explode if it overheats. Overall, the Control Group Warbond brings more chaos to the Helldivers 2 battlefield than anything, and it can either prove to be a lot of fun for players or incredibly frustrating.

The wearer may experience death should the singularity fully collapse.

As of now, there are no plans for Helldivers 2 to come to Game Pass.

The Control Group Warbond May Only Be Suited for a Specific Type of Player

For the Helldivers who love putting their lives in the hands of the Federation of Super Earth for the sake of research, Control Group may be a rewarding Warbond. However, for players who are more interested in practical stratagems, Control Group could prove to be more of a headache than anything.

Using many of the items included in Control Group requires a delicate balancing act that can be incredibly difficult to achieve when fighting off the Illuminate on the battlefield. It's a matter of taste, but for those who are in the mood for some serious risk, trying out the LIFT-182 Warp Pack could be the perfect stratagem to shake things up.

item.title: Destiny 2: Xur Exotic Armor, Weapon, and Recommendations for July 11
item.description:
Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. The countdown is on as the launch of Destiny 2 The Edge of Fate is right around the corner. BUngie continues to reveal new gameplay and sandbox changes coming alongside the release, which aims to really shake up many of the core Destiny 2 foundations.

Specifically, Bungie is planning to balance its weapons, which also means many exotics are getting buffed as well. For Edge of Fate, Destiny 2 is providing buffs to overlooked exotics, including Wicked Implement, Heartshadow, and more. In fact, Hierarchy of Needs is getting a number of changes to make it more flexible to use, while also getting a Gjallarhorn style buff where any allied bow user can take advantage of the Guidance Ring.

For now, the weekend merchant Xur is back with a new inventory of gear for Destiny 2 players. Follow this guide for his current weekend location, news on his exotic cipher quest, as well as a review of all the exotic and legendary gear he's brought for the weekend of July 11, 2025.

Where is Xur?

Xur has now taken up permanent residence in the Bazaar area inside The Tower, so there's no more hunting when the weekend comes around.

Since the Bazaar is located between both fast travel points, players can pick either one to load into. Head into the area where Ikora and Hawthorne are and look for the Ramen Shop towards the back wall. While facing the shop, the alley is to the right, where Xur is standing.

Destiny 2 Class Armor and Exotic Cipher

Xur's role continues to offer the usual weekly quests, exotics, and legendary gear. Not only are these quests required to purchase a second fated engram, but they're necessary to acquire legacy exotic gear from the Tower kiosk. Players can earn a new cipher by completing strikes and winning crucible or gambit matches. Gain bonus points for playing with clan mates or finishing more challenging activities.

item.title: Infinity Nikki: How to Find All Gifties in Blue Tears Season (1.7 Update)
item.description:
The variety of challenge activities found in Infinity Nikki continues to expand with each passing season. One that has proven to be especially popular is the Where Are the Gifties challenge, and it's made its return once more for the game's Blue Tears (1.7) season update.

This series of Gifties in Infinity Nikki sends players to various locales in Breezy Meadow, and some may be trickier to find than others. Here's how and where to find them all.

How to Find Where Are the Gifties Challenge in Infinity Nikki

As usual, to find the latest iteration of the Where Are the Gifties challenge, start by clicking on the Events icon at the top of your HUD. This will bring you to the menu for the current season's challenges and sidequests. Look for the 'Time to Collect' option on the right side (seen above) and select it.

You'll immediately be taken to the 'When Blue Tears Overflow' outfit challenge. Instead, look to the left side and select the Gifty icon (second one down), and that will bring you to the 'Where Are the Gifties?' challenge menu. There, you can track your progress with the challenge and view all potential rewards for finding the Gifties. You can earn said rewards each time you find a Gifty, and then once you find them all, you'll earn an additional bonus reward of 50 x Diamonds .

How to Complete Where Are the Gifties Challenge in Infinity Nikki (Blue Tears Season)

There are a total of five Gifties to find for this challenge, and they're scattered in various locations around Breezy Meadow, the focal point of this season's story. You'll be given a visual hint in the challenge menu for each Gifty's location, narrowing down the area you have to search.

When you get close to the Gifty's hiding spot, you'll hear a sing-song voice, which is your second hint. Remember that all Gifties are two-dimensional, resembling animated stickers, so they'll always be stuck to the side of a surface.

Fishing by the Lake

  • Rewards: 30 x Diamonds, 80 x Shiny Bubbles, 35 x Shining Particles, 5 x Glimmer Threads

To find the first Gifty in this challenge, you need to head to the lake where the Serpentine Ruins are, as part of the season's main storyline. You can reach this area via the Abandoned Fanatic Wisher Camp Warp Spire and make your way through the groups of Esselings until you reach the lake.

Use the stones to safely cross to the center of the lake, where the Sith's Memory Realm entrance is. Run toward the right side of this small isle and stay close to the edge, by the water. The fishing Gifty can be found on the side of a rocky ledge (seen above).

Catching Bugs in the Meadow

  • Rewards: 30 x Diamonds, 80 x Shiny Bubbles, 35 x Shining Particles, 5 x Glimmer Threads

To find the next Gifty, head to the Bug Catcher's Cabin (via the respective Warp Spire) in the Bug Song Hills area of Breezy Meadow. Run around to the backside of the windmill cabin. The Gifty is on the side of the building, near a woven beehive decoration.

Tear Bottle Dreamwalk

  • Rewards: 30 x Diamonds, 80 x Shiny Bubbles, 35 x Shining Particles, 5 x Glimmer Threads

This Gifty is located further north in Breezy Meadow. Head to the Meadow Wharf via the respective Warp Spire, which is the same area where the first level of the Lights Guiding the Way mini-game takes place (Lost Scholar), for reference. Instead of crossing the pier at the wharf, run on the beach alongside the pier on the left side. You'll find the Gifty on the side of a wooden crate (seen above).

Firefly Chase by the Wall

  • Rewards: 30 x Diamonds, 80 x Shiny Bubbles, 35 x Shining Particles, 5 x Glimmer Threads

This is one of the more difficult Gifties to find for this challenge. Start by heading to the Relic Hill area in Breezy Meadow, where you can find various stone castle ruins. Use the Relic Hill Warp Spire to get there more easily. Then, turn and head directly south (see map location above) until you find one of the southernmost castle ruins, per the hint picture provided. The Gifty can be found on the side of one of the building's stone pillars.

Gifty's Elegant Moment

  • Rewards: 30 x Diamonds, 80 x Shiny Bubbles, 35 x Shining Particles, 5 x Glimmer Threads

The final Gifty is in a location that may seem familiar to you. It's the same spot (Shimmer Pond) where you face off against the Sovereign of Elegant, also known locally as the Banshee. Since she only appears at night (22:00-4:00), you may want to visit this area outside of those hours, to avoid triggering the challenge unprepared.

You can use either the Relic Hill Warp Spire or the Meadow Wharf Warp Spire to get to Shimmer Pond (seen above) more easily. Once you arrive, circle the tree in the center of the pond, and the Gifty is on the side of the rocky outcrop along the back.

item.title: Umamusume: Pretty Derby - How to Join Clubs
item.description:
There are several mechanics that players unlock as they progress in Umamusume: Pretty Derby , but the Clubs feature stands out as one of the most useful, as it allows players to interact with each other in entirely new ways. Through this feature, for instance, it becomes possible to request specific items to enhance the horsegirls obtained through the gacha system.

However, joining one of the clubs in Umamusume: Pretty Derby will necessitate some grinding, since the main requirement involves strengthening certain characters through the Career Mode and consistently achieving decent results. For those unsure about how this game system works, what benefits it provides, and what it takes to unlock it, this guide covers the key information to help players progress more efficiently.

How to Unlock Clubs in Umamusume: Pretty Derby

To unlock the ability to either create or join a club in Umamusume: Pretty Derby , players must assemble a veteran team whose combined score reaches at least 20,000 points in the Team Trials mode — enough to hit Rank E3 . This can take a while, as only five characters are allowed, meaning each needs to average around 4,000 points.

The best way to earn this score is by training each character through the Gacha’s Career Mode , also known as the Ura Finales . Winning the tournament isn't required, but completing various character goals and acquiring useful skills during the playthrough is crucial. These are the two primary factors that affect a character's rating in the game.

Usually, completing seven of the character’s Goals is enough to get a good score for Rank E3 in Team Trials.

For those struggling in Career Mode and ending up with low ratings, a good tip is to spend points upgrading the relevant Supporting Cards for each character. This can be done in the Enhancements menu, and the better those cards are, the more attributes and benefits the horsegirls will receive, leading to better results in races.

In addition to upgrading Support Cards, players should also rotate the characters they train in each Ura Finale, as the same horsegirl can't be used more than once in a Team Trials team . So, even if one run doesn’t yield a satisfying result, it’s usually better to try a different character rather than replay the Career Mode with the same one in hopes of a better rating.

What is the Purpose of Clubs in Umamusume: Pretty Derby?

While it's possible to play the gacha without joining a club, players who aim to quickly improve their characters should make reaching 20,000 points in Team Trials Mode a top priority. This is because it unlocks essential mechanics for horsegirl progression, including:

  • Access to Club Chat , where up to 10 Shoes can be requested daily.
  • Donating Shoes to other players grants Club Points, which can be exchanged for valuable items.

Beyond these direct gameplay benefits, joining a club in Umamusume: Pretty Derby also allows players to socialize in the chat, exchange tips on how to improve their horsegirls, and, most importantly, make new friends. Prioritizing Career Mode to build a strong enough team to unlock this feature is one of the best early game strategies.

item.title: No Sleep For Kaname Date Developers Talk Bringing Date Back As The Protagonist
item.description:
The 2019 visual novel adventure game AI: THE SOMNIUM FILES introduced the world to Kaname Date, a quick-witted and eccentric detective with a mysterious past. After taking a backseat in 2022's AI: THE SOMNIUM FILES - nirvanA Initiative, Date returns as the protagonist (and title character) of No Sleep For Kaname Date From AI: THE SOMNIUM FILES. Date's return to the spotlight was an exciting one for No Sleep For Kaname Date's development team, as well as something highly anticipated by the series' fans.

The Series' Fans Wanted Kaname Date Back

In a conversation with Game Rant, director and scenario writer Kazuya Yamada and series director and scenario supervisor Kotaro Uchikoshi revealed that bringing Date back as the protagonist was something that fans had very much wanted. "We actually monitor and search through posts on X more closely than you might think," Yamada revealed. "The idea of making Date the protagonist was based on considering everyone's opinions."

Kaname Date intrigued fans with his compelling story in AI: THE SOMNIUM FILES, where his involvement in the tricky New Cyclops Killings serial murder case forced him to confront his own missing memories and convoluted past. In nirvanA Initiative, Date played a more minor role, with the protagonist slot shared between newcomer Kuruto Ryuki and Date's adoptive daughter, Mizuki Date.

But fans wanted more of Date, and so he takes on another mysterious investigation in No Sleep For Kaname Date when his friend Iris Sagan is kidnapped and forced to play a strange escape game. Both Ryuki and Mizuki return in supporting roles, and Yamada hinted that writing Ryuki from Date's perspective was a fun experience for him. "I believe I was able to bring out a new charm in Ryuki," Yamada revealed.

Writing Kaname Date Again Felt Like Coming Home

Both Yamada and Uchikoshi expressed a feeling of love towards Kaname Date and were delighted to see him make his grand return. Uchikoshi loved how much his fans enjoyed Date and his previous adventures, saying, "I truly feel the love for the AI series from so many fans. I'm confident that once everyone plays No Sleep For Kaname Date, their love for this series will further deepen." When asked what it was like returning to Date's story after years of absence, Yamada described it as such:

"In Japan, there's an expression: "a sense of comfort, like being at your parents' home," and that’s exactly how it felt to me, since I also wrote some of the dialogue for the Somnium parts in the first game. Kaname Date is a character who truly shines in both comedic and serious moments, so writing his lines was really enjoyable."

No Sleep for Kaname Date takes place between the events of the first two games, so it remains to be seen what new adventures Date will get up to - or how he will cope with the truth about himself he learned during AI: THE SOMNIUM FILES. He'll also be working alongside two returning characters: Iris Sagan and Ota Matushita, who become playable characters for the newly added Escape segments after playing a supportive role in the previous two titles.

However the investigation goes, players will be able to reunite with the smart but unusual ABIS detective who bickers with his AI-Ball partner Aiba, dreams of moving to the hot spring town of Atami, and increases his power by reading adult magazines. There is truly no other character quite like Kaname Date, and No Sleep for Kaname Date promises to be a memorable journey for its players and characters alike.
